cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DM, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with a Multi-Armed Bandit (MAB) problem with graph structure, which is a common topic in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The use of Bayesian algorithms and Thompson Sampling also suggests a focus on probabilistic methods, which is often associated with the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The problem of finding the maximum expected reward along a path also involves optimization and decision-making, which are relevant to sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). The paper also discusses the performance of different algorithms, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) or cs.IT (Information Theory).
